content.description: The right most climb in the Mines of Moria.  Sit start with right hand on the crimp facing the hill and left on the arete slab ledge.  Make your way up the climb, pressing against the left wall to keep balance. Make your way through some sweet pipe indent features, crossing to the left tower and top out through the apex. (Bottom slab floor and top ledge of right tower are off)
content.location: Located on the arete to the right of Balrog’s Throne, equivalent to the entrance to the Mines of Moria.  Start with your right hand on the crimp facing the entrance and left on the slab ledge on the arete.

content.description: DAB WARNING! A fun true extension to Orc Tunnel testing your strength and mental fortitude not to dab on the ground or the rock beside you.
content.protection: Maybe one lower down to prop yourself up.
content.location: Located below the landing to Orc Blade/behind the Quarry Boulder. Start with both hands matched on the right side of the Boulder, when looking at Mines. Use heel/toe compression to work to the other side and rotate yourself around and up to the jug ledge for the topout.

content.description: DAB WARNING! A fun super low-ball testing your ab strength not to dab.
content.protection: NO PADS (maybe a thin one or a rug of some sorts)
content.location: Located on the small overhung rock below the Orc Blade landing and right behind Quarry Boulder. Start somewhat under the rock on the side closest to Quarry with a compression on each side of the overhang and traverse your way left toward Mines proper for a few moves to a jug ledge and roll over to the topout.

content.description: Start similar to Balrog’s Throne, but stay on the face so one hand on the crimp flake and one on a small lower crimp.  Work your way into more sharp crimps finishing up and slightly to the left through a sketchy mantle/rollover topout.
content.location: Located on the right side of The Mines of Moria just to the left of Balrog’s Throne.  Stays on the left face of the arete.

content.description: A fun climb allowing you to slap your way up a slightly overhung peak. Start low with one hand on each side of the climb, slapping your way up through the topout.
content.location: Mining for Mithril is the left most climb in the Mines or Moria. It is a fairly obvious overhung peak to the back left of the Quarry boulder just in front of The Great Gates of Moria.

content.description: Climb the dirty crack straight up avoiding the slanting slab rock on the left. Dirty and easy.
content.location: Middle of the Mines of Moria wall. It starts a few feet left of the jug for Black Chasm. It is the pretty obvious dirty crack going straight up the wall.

content.description: Starts one hand on the sloppy rail on the right face and left on the arete. Work your way up a mix of some slopers and crimp side pulls through the topout.
content.location: The leftmost arete feature of the Mines.  Located directly behind Mining for Mithril and the same starting holds as Dwarven Riches.

content.description: The first couple of moves are the same as Gates of Moria, but instead of working up the arete moves out to and offset pinch eventually topping out towards the right on the main face.
content.location: Located in the exact area of Gates of Moria, directly behind Mining for Mithril.  The start is the same as Gates with right on the sloper rail and left on the arete.

content.description: Short warmup problem starting on the juggy holds along the crack.  Make your way into a nice right hand and up through the topout.
content.location: Located on the left side of the same boulder as Gates of Moria. Starts on the crack continues up through the topout.

content.description: Starts on the top ledge, above where Two Towers begins.  Traverse your way left over to the other face and top out through the middle.
content.location: Located at the entrance of the Mines of Moria on the arete to the right of Balrog’s Throne.  Starts on the top ledge of the arete above the start of Two Towers.

content.description: Start on the same hold as Durin’s Stone, but works it’s way right to a triangle hold, followed by a drop knee into a sidepull ledge up to a crimp and eventually the topout.
content.location: Located on the same boulder as Gates of Moria and same start as Durin’s Stone.

content.description: A simple big dyno up to a sloping/juggy ledge straight into the topout.
content.location: Located directly in the middle of The Mines of Moria and behind the Quarry Boulder.

content.description: A collection of jettied rocks zig-zagging behind the Quarry Boulder. Offers some cool unique features for the Woods with a few sharper holds. The the slab rock floor is off for all climbs.
